Armstrong.Action: Remains intensely focused and confident during severe turbulence, performing technical checks accurately inside the X-15 cockpit.
Calmly hits switches and maintains protocol despite severe turbulence, showing control and focus under pressure.
Remains detached and methodical, carefully monitoring gauges and ignoring adrenaline spike.
Successfully manages the high-speed X-15 rocket flight, reacting skillfully under extreme G-forces, making precise control inputs, and adjusting trajectory at high altitude and speed.
Keeps calm and focused on altitude gauge while the plane is upside down and losing altitude.
Struggles to control the plane under extreme G-forces but manages to flip it right-side up.
Communicates clearly and updates ground control on his status and location.
Attempts to glide the engine-less plane as far as possible despite limited altitude and difficult conditions.
Carefully stacks away all papers and books after working late, showing respect for shared spaces and order.
Leaves bed quietly early in the morning without waking Janet, avoiding disturbance.
Does not engage socially with coworkers who greet him casually and awkwardly, focusing instead on work.
Carefully stacks all marked-up medical books, papers, and notebook away before leaving the basement office.
Is wide awake early morning and leaves quietly without disturbance.
Engages directly with colleagues early in the morning working through technical data despite social pressure to take a break.
Glances thoughtfully at the memo and diagram, showing curiosity and absorption in the challenge.
Reaches for the memo and engages with the problem despite initial doubt surrounding feasibility.
Participates calmly and patiently in stressful and uncomfortable astronaut selection tests, indicating self-control and resilience.
Calmly shakes hands with senior officials without showing undue impression or nerves.
Does not boast about or highlight his Navy combat pilot experience despite its impressiveness.
Responds succinctly and logically to technical questions about the lunar rendezvous decision, showing understanding and thoughtful assessment.
Shows some social awkwardness in interaction with John Glenn, not engaging warmly or fluidly in the conversation.
Wraps his arms around Janet in an attempt to bridge the emotional divide despite his unresponsiveness.
Looks out the window, unresponsive and emotionally distant during family supper.
Clearly identifies key technical challenges in lunar orbit insertion and rendezvous, demonstrating detailed knowledge and realistic assessment.
Maintains composure and professionalism when discussing difficult personal matters, showing emotional control amidst stress.
Appears uncertain and unresponsive after receiving important news, showing possible hesitation or internal struggle.
Sits attentively taking copious notes during a critical briefing, remaining analytical and intent despite grim information about Soviet advancements.
Does not show visible frustration or distraction when peers appear concerned, maintaining focus on learning and understanding mission details.
Engrossed in work, does not immediately acknowledge wife entering or door opening.
Remains totally calm and composed during the tense rocket countdown while others appear nervous and anxious.
Engrossed in studying a thick technical binder labeled GEMINI, indicating focus and dedication to preparation.
Shows concern on his face while waiting for astronauts to emerge from the submerged capsule; clenching his hand and scanning anxiously.
Stares but does not move to assist when a fellow astronaut is in trouble underwater.
Ed expresses warmth and reassurance to Neil over comms, showing friendliness and a sincere connection.
Neil smiles, seeming bemused by Ed’s warmth and the strength of their connection, revealing a human and trusting interaction.
Neil, despite the warmth, shows yearning and is lost in thought alone under the stars, indicating some emotional distance or introspection rather than outward warmth.
Neil and Elliot smile at each other, showing closeness and subtle friendly warmth.
Focuses on system checks and mission details calmly and professionally, no strong emotional engagement visible here.
Receives command of Gemini 8 and accepts responsibility for a key mission involving rendezvous and docking, showing confidence and readiness.
Plans to start training immediately with Elliot, showing proactive behavior and commitment to preparation.
Does not express doubt or hesitation when assigned a strenuous EVA planned with Dave Scott, implying trust in his own and teammates' abilities.
Described as able to run Dave ragged in training, implying high expectations and demanding skill.
Referenced by others as a benchmark for capability (Neil seen as a tough trainer), indicating competence.
Stands quietly watching Rick and Mark sleeping soundly, eyes filled with tears.
Keeps calm and composed despite a parachute harness malfunction; does not panic when Pete Conrad struggles with a clogged catch.
Shows no direct intervention but remains focused, confident as communications confirm no hold is needed despite the glitch.
Punches in roll and pitch programs under high acceleration (7G) during launch with apparent control and focus.
Communicates status calmly and effectively over comms (DCS looks good, pulse good).
Maintains composure and awareness during staging ignition despite terrifying visuals (fireball, exploding rocket appearance).
Quickly gets into position and squeezes the thruster upon countdown without hesitation.
Pen slips out of his hand and floats off, causing a minor delay requesting repetition.
Successfully maneuvers Gemini to station keep about 150 feet from the Agena, executing difficult docking maneuvers precisely and calmly.
Shows calm and confident attitude flying the Gemini despite tense and high-pressure situation, indicating strong mastery and skill.
No visible hesitation or errors in controlling the spacecraft during critical docking approach.
Neil holds a meal packet up to a nozzle and injects it with water despite noticing possible air bubbles; shows pragmatism and care in food preparation.
Quickly follows Dave Scott's order to cut the Agena's thrusters, showing responsiveness and trust in team decisions.
Keeps eyes on the 8 ball and monitors the ship’s behavior closely, demonstrating situational awareness and vigilance.

When the ship starts spinning uncontrollably, despite attempts to stabilize and shut down thrusters, Armstrong continues working the problem with focus, showing persistence and problem-solving under pressure.
Yanks breakers to cut all power immediately after detecting thruster stuck; rapidly analyzes gauges to assess situation.
Commands Dave clearly and coordinates re-arming and firing of re-entry rockets under extreme physical strain.
Keeps forcing himself to stay conscious and focused despite physical and mental exhaustion.
Fire of re-entry boosters causes spinning to increase before stabilizing; initial unintended consequence shows partial loss of control.
Calmly surveys the landing area and weighs his limited options despite frustration.
Acknowledges the need to follow protocol and does not act impulsively despite the urge to argue against re-entry decision.
Ed pushes into the house with Janet, shutting the door firmly to block the press.
Pat is watching TV obliviously while the news interrupts, showing lack of immediate awareness.
Neatly checks headings and helmets, prepares for retrofire procedure confidently.
Manually fires retro-rockets precisely despite communication cut out, showing skilled control under pressure.
Struggles with harness lock, jams the buckle together causing restriction of right arm, indicating a moment of frustration and imperfection.
Is deeply engaged with technical schematics and data, showing focused analysis and use of engineering tools.
Expresses strong dissatisfaction with sensationalist media portrayal, wanting accuracy and control over his narrative.
Slams down the phone in frustration and abruptly leaves, showing poor emotional control and potential difficulty managing public relations.
Hunched over schematics and data, actively working the problem of isolating a single thruster malfunction.
Seeks a break when stuck, showing awareness of mental fatigue.
Engages positively and confidently in social interaction, lightening tension after a conflict.
Ed comforts Neil, assures him the crash wasn’t his fault despite Neil’s self-doubt and distraction.
Ed laughs with Neil, sharing a moment of humor about Neil’s flying mishap.
Keeps cool under intense pressure during the mission, successfully docking and returning the ship home.
Feels nervous and awkward during the meeting with Gilruth and Deke, showing visible signs of anxiety.
Complies professionally with the unexpected request to represent at the White House despite personal reluctance.
Keeps working to loosen the hatch latch despite his arm being engulfed by fire and his suit melting.
Starts to panic when the latch isn't budging and the situation worsens.
Neil focuses intently and corrects the lunar landing test vehicle's translation rates amidst rough winds, demonstrating technical skill and calm under pressure.
Smashes the phone receiver repeatedly in a rage until physically injured, showing loss of control and ineffective coping.
Calmly pilots the LLTV under extremely difficult and dangerous conditions, maintains focus on gauges and controls despite emergency.
Attempts multiple corrections quickly when the craft behaves erratically, showing skill and presence of mind.
Ignores or barely acknowledges urgent instructions to bail out, continuing to try to fix the problem.
Pulls the ejection handle at the last moment when no other option remains.
Neil studies data from his LLTV crash intently, jots down notes, and eats in a controlled, efficient manner.
Neil is so engrossed in his work that he is oblivious to his surroundings and the social cues around him.
Processes the gravity of being one of three men who might land on the moon, showing awareness and readiness.
No direct action or decision shown in this excerpt; reaction is mainly internal and observational.
The passage does not show Armstrong's direct actions or speech, only reactions of others; no warmth-related behavior observed.
No direct action or statement from Armstrong in this excerpt; he remains silent or passive during the Soyuz re-entry crisis.
Remains methodical and concentrated after a terrifying launch, washing his hands calmly and not succumbing to panic or outward emotion.
Does not join the momentary cheers after a successful launch, instead heads for the door showing seriousness and focus rather than distraction by celebration.
Shrugs and turns back to the sink without acknowledging the magnitude of the mission command offered, demonstrating calm confidence and unflappability.
Buzz pours over a desk full of diagrams, equations, and trajectories for the lunar landing, showing deep focus and preparation.
Neil considers choices and asks for 24 hours, demonstrating thoughtfulness and confidence in decision-making.
Packs methodically and emotionlessly, showing preparation and focus before the mission.
Insists on continuing to pack despite his wife’s emotional plea, showing prioritization of mission tasks over family.
Hesitates when asked by his son why he has to go, revealing some internal uncertainty or difficulty communicating complex motivations.
Gives Janet a perfunctory peck and leaves without looking back
Remains totally unfazed and calm while eating breakfast before the mission.
Closes his eyes calmly as the helmet is placed and oxygen hisses, showing mental preparation and control.
Maintains intense focus on checklist despite distractions and unsettling surroundings.
Takes the lead in moving onto the launch platform and handles oxygen tank responsibly before handing it to tech for assistance.
Briefly pauses and closes eyes upon seeing techs resembling old friends, indicating momentary emotional distraction.
Follows checklist precisely during the intense rocket roll and stages the rocket correctly despite extreme g-forces and physical discomfort.
Maintains focus and ignores terrifying changes outside the spacecraft, prioritizing mission tasks.
Communicates clearly and timely with Buzz and CAPCOM, confirming each stage successfully.
Ignores protocol to re-establish contact and proceeds to prep for separation confidently, taking initiative.
Successfully executes separation maneuver, controlling the spacecraft skillfully despite surprising crew with loud pyro explosion.
Carefully performs precise spacecraft rotation and docking maneuvers with clear communication and calm command.
Focuses intently on the mission and navigation tasks despite awe-inspiring surroundings; points out precise location and timing for the lunar landing.
Dismissive attitude towards concerns about the fuel tank margin, showing confidence but perhaps overconfidence.
Neil struggles with a loose breaker on the console but manages to fix it under pressure and proceed with the descent preparation calmly.
Buzz suggests reporting the breaker issue, but Neil ignores the protocol to address it immediately himself.
Eyes rapidly alternate between the alarm and instruments, shows situational awareness despite alarm distractions.
Pushes through fatigue and adrenaline to maintain control during lunar module descent.
Annoyed by repeated alarms but continues to focus on flying the module effectively.
Ignores a third alarm to prioritize manual control and safe landing.
Makes a quick decision to switch to manual control to avoid a hazardous landing zone.
Remains focused and intent on the landing despite warnings and concerns about fuel, showing confidence and skill under pressure.
Does not verbally respond to questions about fuel status, risking communication clarity with ground control.
Ignores warnings about critically low fuel and continues landing with intense focus and determination.
Refuses to abort landing despite fuel levels dropping below safety margins, potentially risking mission failure or danger.
Nods awkwardly and gives a tight smile when praised by the guard and escort.
Remains quiet and distant, showing tension rather than openness or friendliness.
Signs a model rocket for a little girl despite being overwhelmed by the media
Steps out into a chaotic media circus and awkwardly but politely interacts with a little girl by signing her model rocket despite feeling overwhelmed.
Appears visibly tense, antsy, and overwhelmed amid intense media attention and a huge crowd, showing internal struggle to maintain composure.
Accepts public applause with a numb nod despite feeling devastated and isolated.
Does not visibly engage with or acknowledge family or friends amid the crowd and fanfare, showing emotional withdrawal.
Cuts the engine and adjusts controls precisely during extreme flight conditions, maintaining focus despite violent shaking and odd noises.
Ignores an odd mechanical whine that seems out of place during critical phases of flight.
Fails to notice the plane isn’t turning despite control input, altitude climbs unexpectedly, indicating lack of situational awareness.
Remains calm and focused despite a critical situation and equipment failure, shows intensity and focus.
Responds properly by switching to reaction controls quickly after realizing aerodynamic controls are not responding.

Manages a nearly powerless landing in extremely difficult circumstances, clears smoke from the cockpit, follows instructions promptly, struggles but maintains control under extreme stress, and lands the plane safely.
Makes notes in his logbook after a difficult flight, shows attention to detail and thoroughness.
Proposes to replicate the unusual flight conditions in the simulator to understand the 'atmosphere bounce'.
Methodically straightens Rick’s sheets and carefully glues a wing on a model plane, finding calm in precise, skillful activity.
Shows emotional denial when discussing Gemini and Apollo missions, avoiding engagement with potential career opportunities.
Hugs his family close and tight at the funeral, showing physical comfort during grief.
Is impassive and does not cry at the funeral, maintaining emotional reserve.
Slips away from the gathering, barely enduring condolences and soft pats on the back.

Maintains meticulously organized medical and scientific research materials, takes detailed and tidy notes, methodically logs radiation levels and side effects, repeatedly studies key research papers showing determination.
Exhibits emotional restraint and composure during the funeral, despite intense personal grief, supporting family while silently enduring condolences.
Remains physically and mentally composed under intense duress during tests, enduring pain without visible weakness or complaint.
Circles the statement 'I like to do my best in whatever I undertake,' showing self-awareness and commitment to effort.
Produces a fairly generic stick figure drawing of himself when asked, indicating possible lack of engagement or minimal effort in some tasks.
Hardens and stares at blank page when asked to draw his family, suggesting emotional struggle or hesitation which may hinder full task execution.
Shakes hands politely with panel members but shows no visible warmth or enthusiasm.
Responds succinctly and without affect to John Glenn's friendly comments; maintains a reserved demeanor.
Engages seriously and respectfully with technical questions, showing professionalism but not warmth.
Responds to reporter's question about motivation with a halting, stiff, uncomfortable answer.
Pat offers cookies and invites neighbors for company and soup, smiling warmly at Janet.
Pat quickly recovers from Janet’s embarrassment and disappointment, maintaining friendliness.
Pat smoothly manages an awkward social interaction with Janet, maintaining composure and making Janet feel at ease despite initial embarrassment.
Neil, present in a highly technical multi-axis trainer, demonstrates knowledge by listening attentively to instructions and attempting to control the device during complex maneuvers.
Persists in retrying the spinning machine despite nausea and difficulty, eventually mastering the control to stop and slow the spin.
Falls and vomits after completing the strenuous test, showing physical weakness.
Eats dinner alone with Janet and their baby; appears distant but shares a moment of dry humor about orbital mechanics.
Does not react overtly to being assigned backup; remains unfazed and does not express frustration or negativity openly.
Calmly accepts backup assignment without complaint, maintains composure despite possible disappointment.
Explains complex orbital mechanics detail enthusiastically and accurately at dinner.
Responds quickly and decisively to the fire, ensures family members' safety by waking Rick and rescuing the baby.
Moves through the smoke and fire despite personal risk, showing care and responsibility for his family.
Recognizes the fire quickly, instructs Janet to call the fire department promptly.
Hustles through smoke-filled hallways to rescue his family members one by one, showing decisive and skillful action under pressure.
Pauses momentarily at the door of Rick’s room to instruct him calmly, showing leadership and presence of mind.
Rushes back into the burning house to save his child despite danger.
Quickly hands the baby to Janet to keep the child safe.
Shows fear and hesitation inside the burning house but overcomes it to rescue his son.
Pushes through flames and smoke, crawls on hands and knees with a wet towel over his face to navigate the burning house in search of Rick.
Quickly hands baby to Janet, recognizing the need to get the child to safety before continuing search.
Freezes momentarily when hearing the terrifying whine of Karen’s Cobalt Machine and experiencing fear of loss.
Carries Rick out of the burning house holding him for dear life despite the danger
Speaks starkly and angrily to Rick who begins to cry
Moves immediately to help save the cars by working with Ed despite personal risk
Stares emotionless at the burning house after the roof collapses
Carries Rick out of the burning house despite faltering, takes charge by instructing others to help save cars from the fire.
Starts to wheeze and struggles to catch his breath while still focusing on the fire and what needs to be done.
Stares emotionless at the blaze after the house collapses, showing a possible emotional shutdown rather than decisive action.
Neil shows a hint of emotion wiping off the bracelet from the rubble, indicating a personal connection or empathy.
Neil is surprised and grateful when Ed gives him smoke detectors for every house.
Neil nods awkwardly when complimented for handling the situation well, showing some reserved sincerity.
Carefully inspects the rubble and identifies the probable origin of the fire from a paneling nail.
Persistently digs into the roof despite the fire inspector's exhaustion and exasperation.
Shows surprise and gratitude when Ed offers a new smoke detector, indicating openness to helpful tools.
Describes the aftermath as just an inconvenience and time spent on unproductive tasks, showing a practical and unemotional perspective.
Ed chuckles good-naturedly after explaining the star navigation sim, causing a bond to form among the group.
Ed shoots a look at Elliot when he walks outside with beers, showing some sarcasm about wasting a Saturday night.
Watches the EVA footage closely, shows focused attention and understanding of the mission complexity.
Smiles at Elliot with quiet confidence during mission briefing, indicating calm and composed demeanor.
Maintains focus on pre-launch communications and protocols despite distractions and emotional moments.
Pauses and reflects briefly before proceeding, showing thoughtfulness rather than impulsiveness.
Distracted by a personal moment and appears yearning, but still handles duties appropriately.
Stands silently with Ed in awful silence after hearing about the crash and deaths of Elliot and Charlie.
Unable to provide reassurance or answers to his son Rick about the Agena, showing emotional struggle.
Shows awareness of project delays but remains optimistic about handling pressure.
Appears mentally distracted and unable to fully respond to son's technical question.
Sits down quietly to process traumatic news, indicating composure under emotional distress.
Practices taking celestial readings with a sextant late at night, taking notes diligently.
Responds quietly and avoids confrontation when challenged by Buzz Aldrin about not being aggressive enough.
Shows emotional vulnerability by hesitating before entering bedroom and looking tenderly at his sleeping children with tears in his eyes.
Responds coldly and sharply to Ed when told to be with his family, telling him to mind his own business.
Acknowledges his lack of full knowledge about the crash and refuses to pretend otherwise.
Demonstrates emotional control by containing himself and focusing on taking readings despite personal distress.
Expresses determination to practice docking, emphasizing commitment to critical skills.
Responds coldly and dismissively to emotional concern from Ed, telling him to mind his own business.
Shows vulnerability and emotional hesitation when confronted with his family responsibilities, hesitating before going to bed.
Neil (Armstrong) explains the concept of rendezvous to Rick and Mark clearly and patiently.
Neil nods acknowledging Janet's presence with a brief greeting, showing calmness under subtle emotional tension.
Neil notices Pete Conrad struggling to buckle Dave’s parachute harness and is observant of details in the pre-launch environment.
Confidently responds to comms, maintaining focus and composure during final pre-launch procedures despite stress and physical indicators of anxiety.
Maintains readiness and quickly resumes action after receiving 'go' despite heightened heart rate, showing control and professionalism.
Carefully follows mission procedures and checks instruments methodically during critical thruster burn.
Acknowledge slight mistake by saying 'I think we overdid it a little' indicating awareness and ability to self-correct.
Focused on solving problems calmly and working through complex calculations under pressure.
Does not appear in this excerpt to hesitate or make errors while handling the situation.
No direct action or statement present in the excerpt to evaluate competence.
Neil nods to Dave, coordinating docking procedure smoothly and methodically communicates status.
Neil gently squeezes throttle to control approach for docking despite jarring contact, maintaining control.
Remains composed and focused despite violent tumbling of the spacecraft; attempts to diagnose and respond to the stuck thruster problem.
Shows signs of physical distress (eyes rolling back, graying out) under extreme conditions but continues to try to control the situation.
Keeps calm and focused during a critical situation, monitors RCS fuel closely, and follows Neil's direction to manage spacecraft stability.
No direct action or statement shown in this excerpt; observed silence and lack of participation in the meeting where others huddle and Neil sits waiting alone.
Responds to intense questioning calmly and with thoughtful, measured answers during the press conference.
Hesitates when responding to technical questions about the failure, indicating uncertainty.
Uses humor effectively to defuse tension during a stressful press conference.
Remains composed and patient even when others are not responsive or supportive, such as when others do not stand with him.
Internally appears exhausted and blank, suggesting mental fatigue from pressure.
Slams down the phone in frustration after feeling misrepresented in an article, ignores Janet's concern and walks out.
Shares a quiet moment of détente with Ed after an earlier fight, responding to Ed’s approach and inviting a break.
Engages in relaxed social drinking with peers, sharing jokes and laughter, showing friendliness and genuine excitement for others' success.
Shows sincere interest and enthusiasm for Ed’s news about being chosen for the team, encouraging the conversation positively.
Reflects quietly on his flying experiences, acknowledges mistakes such as crashing an Aeronca due to distraction, and regrets lack of preparation.
Displays openness and honesty about his failings, showing self-awareness and capacity to learn.
Shows doubt and second-guesses his actions after the crash, indicating moments of insecurity.
Makes perfect pancakes for Janet despite her irritation.
Nervously obeys orders without complaint, showing respect and trustworthiness.
Silently accepts the pressure to attend the White House event despite personal reluctance.
Flustered and agitated when packing, shows vulnerability and receives comforting from Janet; pulls her back for a moment of intimacy.
Examines the lunar landing simulator diagrams and assesses the risks thoughtfully, concluding the simulator might be too dangerous to use.
Grimaces when Ed sarcastically calls him the 'Hero of Gemini 8,' showing some discomfort but maintaining professionalism.
Hesitates and repacks his suitcase meticulously multiple times, showing thoroughness though also some agitation and doubt.
Clings to a beer, appearing uncomfortable and vulnerable during formal event.
Flinches at applause and flashing bulbs, indicating sensitivity and sincerity.
Responds humbly and avoids boasting when questioned by senator.
Appears uneasy and stiff at the formal White House event, flinching at applause and flashbulbs, suggesting discomfort in social or political settings.
Remains reserved and quiet, clinging to a beer while others talk about Apollo, indicating possible social awkwardness or discomfort in public/political discourse.
Responds to a senator's implication with a calm, measured reply that references historical perspective: 'We learned to fly sixty years ago...', demonstrating thoughtful, considered communication.
Responds briefly and without engaging in political banter or gossip, simply ordering a beer and staying quiet.
Avoids or does not engage in political debate and awkwardly drifts away from the Senator, appears out of place in the political context.
Acknowledges poor polling data and remains quiet instead of spreading misinformation or overconfidence.
Advocates for continuing risky test flights despite setbacks, showing commitment to gaining knowledge through failure.
Minimizes dangers by focusing on the success of ejection rather than the crash, possibly showing overconfidence or ignoring risks.
Neil (Armstrong) quietly washes his hands, concentrating methodically after the launch, showing restraint and focus rather than joining the cheering.
Neil shrugs and shows subtle pleasure when offered command of Apollo 11, but does not express excitement or boast.
Responds to questions with brief, somewhat detached answers; shows little emotion or engagement with reporters.
Expresses hope that the achievement will be recognized as a group effort, not just individual glory.
Remains silent and shows slight irritation when others (Buzz) take over conversation with humor and personal remarks.
Responds to reporters calmly and concisely, maintains composure under pressure.
Gives minimal or evasive answers ('No comment', 'No, I was not'), leading to awkwardness and prompting others to intervene.
Attempts to redirect credit to the team rather than personal glory, showing measured humility and awareness of collective effort.
Hesitates noticeably during a question about personal historical significance, indicating uncertainty or discomfort with public attention.
Keeps packing his suitcase, appears emotionally distant when Janet asks him to spend time with their children before the trip.
Eventually sits down to talk with his sons and answer their questions about the mission.
Quietly reads mission briefing in car, showing focus and preparation before mission
Gives a perfunctory peck to Janet and leaves without a look back, suggesting emotional detachment or prioritization of mission
Neil’s thought it through, he isn’t fazed at all.
Starts checking systems systematically and quickly, flipping switches and confirming systems status.
Oblivious to the stifling atmosphere but continues to work calmly and efficiently.
Maintains calm and steady focus during violent launch shake despite being startled.
Wills himself to focus, monitoring instruments intently during critical moments.
No indication of panic or loss of control during highest stress moments.
Works a calculator calmly despite the shaking and sparks, shows focus and quick calculations.
Shows calmness and confidence in a tense situation where Mike is distracted and pale.
Takes the lead in preparing for separation without panic.
Successfully pilots the CSM to dock with the LM, smoothly executing complex maneuvers and following precise communication instructions.
Uses the sextant to take navigation readings carefully and methodically despite distractions.
Focuses on technical tasks like checking alignment and calculations without being distracted by the emotional grandeur of space.
Stares intensely out the window, resolved and focused despite others being antsy.
Abruptly tells Buzz to sleep to maintain rest before landing, showing practical judgment.
Keeps studying the lunar landing map intently even when tired, demonstrating preparedness and attention to detail.
Remains calm and focused while others are on edge or nervous.
Does not respond to Buzz's comment about bets, maintaining silence instead of engaging.

Calmly stows his gear despite Buzz’s growing anxiety; blinks away vertigo and adapts to disorienting environment; confidently floats through the connecting tunnel and closes the hatch without hesitation.
Does not respond to Buzz’s comment about odds or bets, maintaining silence to avoid adding tension.
Nods to Mike after Mike asks him to come back, indicating clear communication and composed acknowledgment.
Neil, meticulous and careful in preparing his equipment, showing conscientiousness and seriousness about the moment.
Buzz extends a shaky hand to Neil after the landing, a gesture of support and camaraderie.
Neil flinches and struggles to process the emotional impact of the landing, internalizing pain and joy quietly.
Successfully pilots the lunar module to a smooth touchdown, responding precisely to environmental conditions and console indicators.
Shows meticulous and careful behavior when donning his helmet and gloves, demonstrating awareness of the dangers and importance of the moment.
Recovers quickly from a jostle and potentially dangerous situation inside the lunar module by grabbing the ceiling and stopping himself.
Not entirely satisfied but returns to the task at hand, putting on his PLSS and connecting the oxygen tube.
Takes a moment to eye the scribbled sentence 'One small step...' on the pad before proceeding.
Focuses carefully while shimmying down the ladder, keeping eyes on hands and feet to ensure safe descent.
Exhibits internal focus and emotional complexity but does not hesitate or panic during the unknown experience outside.
Delivers the iconic line 'That's one small step for man, one giant leap for mankind' while stepping onto the moon, demonstrating calmness and focus under immense pressure.
Struggles emotionally after stepping onto the moon, shedding tears and becoming momentarily overwhelmed.
Neil calmly assesses the broken engine arm switch and looks for a way to fix the problem despite limited time.
Shows focus and determination during the lunar surface walk, despite physical strain and emotional pain.
Pauses when Buzz asks if the system is on, showing careful attention to detail.
Uses a pen to successfully trigger the engine arm switch after multiple attempts under extreme time pressure.
Maintains focus and composure despite tense conditions and imminent time constraints, preparing for launch.
Appears distracted or distant, with eyes lingering far away at the lunar horizon just before launch.
Responds with a tight smile and maintains composure despite reporters and news vans tailing him.
Sits quietly and processes the overwhelming media attention after Apollo 11, showing restraint and control.
Seems distant and emotionally withdrawn around others, notably Janet and Buzz, which could indicate internal struggle but does not impede outward behavior.
Demonstrates keen focus on work and mission despite public duties; asks earnestly when he can get back to work and go back up again.

Shows emotional struggle and sense of sacrifice by being numb and devastated at being permanently grounded, indicating internal conflict that does not diminish his capability but reveals vulnerability.
